Introduction
The late Middle Ages, spanning from the 14th to the 16th century, witnessed a period of significant economic recession and decline in Western Europe. This decline was triggered by a confluence of factors including the Hundred Years' War, the Black Death, and deeply-rooted structural problems within feudalism.
